contentrichtext.text: :''For ''Fagus'', the [[genus]] of trees, see [[beech]].'' In [[Gallo-Roman religion]], '''Fagus''' was a god known from four inscriptions found in the [[Hautes-Pyrénées]].<ref>Nicole Jufer & Thierry Luginbühl (2001). ''Les dieux gaulois : répertoire des noms de divinités celtiques connus par l'épigraphie, les textes antiques et la toponymie.'' Paris: Editions Errance. ISBN 2-87772-200-7.</ref> The [[Aquitanian language|language]] of this [[Aquitania]]n region has been linked to [[Basque language|Proto-Basque]], rather than to [[Celtic languages|Celtic]]. ''Fāgus'' is [[Latin]] for [[beech]].<ref>Charlton T. Lewis, Charles Short. ''A Latin Dictionary.'' [http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/cgi-bin/ptext?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.04.0059%3Aentry%3D%2317586 Perseus]</ref> {{Celt-myth-stub}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Celtic mythology (ancient)}} [[Category:Gaulish gods]] [[Category:Nature gods]]
